newsitem.title: UK: Wlm Cook attacks "ludicrous" Triplex bid.
newsitem.headline: Wlm Cook attacks "ludicrous" Triplex bid.

text.p: William Cook Plc on Thursday called on shareholders to contine to reject a "ludicrously low bid" from Triplex Lloyd and attacked what it said was an inaccurate response to its higher profit forecast.

In the latest round in the war of words between the two companies, Triplex Lloyd had called Cook's forecast an "implausible short term reaction to our offer". Engineering group Triplex Lloyd is seeking to take over British metal castings company William Cook.
Cook chairman Andrew Cook said the company was confident of meeting its forecast of pre-tax profit of at least 10.7 million stg in the year to March 1997.
"Any suggestion that the forecast upturn is implausible is yet further evidence of their lack of understanding of our business," the chairman said in a statement.
"Once again Triplex Lloyd is indulging in cheap jibes in an attempt to divert shareholders' attention from the key issue which is William Cook's business and prospects," he added.
